qualifiers.toolTip: xia2 will automatically find other images in the dataset, optionally limited to the specified range
Whether or not to refine geometry in dials.index and dials.refine. Most useful when also providing a reference geometry to xia2.
Do not refine the detector distance in dials.index and dials.refine.
Set various parameters for rapid processing, compromising on quality

qualifiers.guiLabel: Closeness to the spindle cutoff for including reflections in refinement

qualifiers.toolTip: Width of bins in degrees.
Fractional loss (relative to the bin with the most counts) after which a bin is flagged as potentially containing blank images.
Fractional loss (relative to the bin with the highest misigma) after which a bin is flagged as potentially containing blank images.
The border around the edge of the image.
The high resolution limit in Angstrom for a pixel to be accepted by the filtering algorithm.
The low resolution limit in Angstrom for a pixel to be accepted by the filtering algorithm.
Set to ``True`` to use a faster, but less accurate, simple px-to-mm mapping by disabling accounting for parallax correction when generating resolution masks.
an untrusted resolution range
then the whole panel is masked out
An untrusted circle (xc, yc, r)
An untrusted rectangle (x0, x1, y0, y1)
The pixel coordinates (fast, slow) that define the corners of the untrusted polygon. Spots whose centroids fall within the bounds of the untrusted polygon will be rejected.
An untrusted pixel (y, x)
The unit cell to generate d_spacings for powder rings.
The space group used to generate d_spacings for powder rings.
The width of an ice ring (in 1/d^2).
The high resolution limit (otherwise use detector d_min)

qualifiers.guiLabel: phil file to pass to dials.find_spots

qualifiers.toolTip: The minimum number of contiguous pixels for a spot to be accepted by the filtering algorithm.

The minimum number of pixels under the image processing kernel that are need to do the thresholding operation. Setting the value between 2 and the total number of pixels under the kernel will force the algorithm to use that number as the minimum. If the value is less than or equal to zero, then the algorithm will use all pixels under the kernel. In effect this will add a border of pixels which are always classed as background around the edge of the image and around any masked out pixels.
The number of standard deviations above the mean in the local area above which the pixel will be classified as strong.
The size of the local area around the spot in which to calculate the mean and variance. The kernel is given as a box
The global threshold value. Consider all pixels less than this value to be part of the background.

qualifiers.guiLabel: phil file to pass to dials.index

qualifiers.toolTip: Maximum length of candidate unit cell basis vectors (in Angstrom).

qualifiers.guiLabel: Number of reciprocal space grid points
Number of reflections per degree for random subset

qualifiers.toolTip: Choose between linear or logarithmic bins for nearest neighbour histogram analysis.
Percentile of NN histogram to use for max cell determination.

qualifiers.guiLabel: phil file to pass to dials.refine

qualifiers.toolTip: Width of scan between checkpoints in degrees

qualifiers.guiLabel: Number of reflections per degree for random subset

qualifiers.toolTip: Least squares unit cell restraints to use in refinement.
Target unit cell parameters for the restraint for this parameterisation

The unit cell target values are associated with sigmas which are used to determine the weight of each restraint. A sigma of zero will remove the restraint at that position. If symmetry constrains two cell dimensions to be equal then only the smaller of the two sigmas will be kept

Select only the specified experiments when looking up which parameterisations to apply these restraints to. If an identified parameterisation affects multiple experiments then the index of any one of those experiments suffices to restrain that parameterisation. If None (the default) then the restraints will be applied to all experiments.
Function to tie group parameter values to
The unit cell parameters are associated with sigmas which are used to determine the weight of each restraint. A sigma of zero will remove the restraint at that position.

Select only the specified experiments when looking up which parameterisations to apply these restraints to. For every parameterisation that requires a restraint at least one experiment index must be supplied. If None (the default) the restraints will be applied to all experiments.

qualifiers.guiLabel: phil file to pass to dials.integrate

qualifiers.toolTip: Outlier rejection performed prior to background fit
Combine partial reflections for output
Minimum combined partiality for output
Mosaicity determination method to use
Use scan varying profile model in integration

qualifiers.guiLabel: Override default profile parameters of dials.integrate

qualifiers.toolTip: Minimum number of reflections required to perform profile modelling.
Minimum number of reflections per degree of sweep required to perform profile modelling.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Handle diamond anvil pressure cell data

qualifiers.toolTip: Correct for attenuation by a diamond anvil cell

guiDefinition.caption: Properties of the mounted diamond anvils

qualifiers.toolTip: The density of the anvil material in kg per cubic metre. The default is the typical density of synthetic diamond.
The thickness in mm of each anvil in the pressure cell. The default is the thickness of the pressure cells in use on beamline I19 at Diamond Light Source.
A 3-vector orthogonal to the anvil surfaces in the laboratory frame when the goniometer is at zero datum, i.e. the axes are all at zero degrees. The vector may be given un-normalised.
The output experiment list file name. If None, don't output an experiment list file.
The output reflection table file.
Choice of scaling model parameterisation to apply
Parameter spacing for scale (rotation) term
Include decay component in scaling
Include an absorption correction in scaling
Parameter spacing for B-factor correction

Expected degree of relative absorption for different scattering paths through the crystal(s). If an option is selected, the scaling model parameters lmax and surface_weight will be set to appropriate values. Relative absorption increases as crystal size increases, increases as wavelength increases and is increased as the crystal dimensions become less equal (i.e. is higher for needle shaped crystals and zero for a spherical crystal). Definitions of the levels and approximate correction magnitude: low: ~1%% relative absorption, expected for typical protein crystals (containing no strongly absorbing atoms) on the order of ~100um measured at ~1A wavelength. medium: ~5%% relative absorption high: >25%% relative absorption, e.g. for measurements at long wavelength or crystals with high absorption from heavy atoms.
Order of spherical harmonics to use for absorption surface, defaults to 4 if no absorption_level is chosen.
Restraint weight applied to spherical harmonic terms in the absorption correction. A lower restraint allows a higher amount of absorption correction. Defaults to 5e5 if no absorption_level is chosen.
If True, one absorption correction model is refined for all sweeps Therefore it should only be used when scaling data from a single crystal
Share the decay model between sweeps.
Use a dose model that depends linearly or quadratically on 1/d
Order of spherical harmonics to use for absorption surface
Number of bins to parameterise decay component
Number of bins in each dimension (applied to both x and y) for binning the detector position for the absorption term of the array model.
Choose from profile fitted or summation intensities, or an optimised combination of profile/sum.
Choice of whether to refine an error model to adjust the intensity sigmas using a two-parameter model.
Choice of how the error models should be optimised in scaling, either a combined more for all sweeps, an individual error model per sweep or in custom user-defined groups.
Specify a subset of sweeps which should share an error model, for the option error_model_grouping=grouped.
Option to turn on/off Levenberg-Marquardt refinement round used to determine error estimates on scale factors. auto will set full_matrix=True if 4 sweeps or less.
Choice of outlier rejection routine. Standard may take a significant amount of time to run for large datasets or high multiplicities, whereas simple should be quick for these datasets.
Cutoff z-score value for identifying outliers based on their normalised deviation within the group of equivalent reflections
Minimum partiality to use for scaling and for post-scaling exported output.
